item.title: Episode 24 The Dresden Files RPG: There's Still Magic In Hollywood
item.description:
On this episode we talk about the Dresden Files RPG from Evil Hat Productions. Two special guests, Paul Tevis and Ryan Macklin, join us this week as we discuss how the Dresden Files RPG allows players to play characters with varying amounts of supernatural power without having lower powered characters out classed by the more powerful ones. We also talk about the process for creating characters. Finally, we talk about challenges and techniques for running the game in a convention setting.

item.title: Episode 17 Grey Ranks Love And War
item.description:
In this episode we wrap up the discussion of our Grey Ranks game. The recap runs a little longer than usual for this episode. Those of you who are not interested in this part of the show may want to skip ahead to 9 minutes 26 seconds into the episode. After the recap, we revisit the topic of playing in a historical setting, this time with the consideration that people who participated in the events are still living. Next we talk about the role mission and personal scenes play in telling your character's story. Lastly, we ask Laura about being the only girl playing in a game with strong themes of love and romance.

item.description:
This week we had to take another break from our Burning Empires game, due to a player absence. Laura, Jesse, Patrick, and Will got together and played a game of Montsegur 1244. We talk about playing within the constraints of real historical events, playing with a set cast of characters and their built in relationships and situation, finally we cover our standard topic for GMless games; who does the game fill the GM's role systematically.

item.title: Episode 9 Humans 1 Vaylen 0
item.description:
In this episode we continue the discussion of our Burning Empires game. We wrapped up the infiltration phase and did a trait vote. We talk about the way the trait vote is supposed to work, what we changed, and why we changed it. We then discuss the need for your side to initiate a conflict when you choose certain maneuvers, and the impact that has on play during the maneuver. After that we take a look back at the infiltration phase from the GM's perspective.

item.title: Episode 2 Infiltration Begins
item.description:
In this Episode we continue the discussion of our ongoing Burning Empires game, specifically our first session of maneuvers in the Infection Phase.  We cover our experience with Burning Empires' learning curve, Duels of Wits, and Fire Fights.

We have settled into our format of summary of fiction, general discussion, player focused discussion, and finally GM focused discussion.  This episode runs for 31 minutes.  Our target length for the show is 30 minutes, so you should expect most future episodes to be approximately the same length.

A slight word of warning, I had to remove some noise during the first couple minutes of this episode.  A side affect of doing this is the audio is slightly distorted during that time.  The audio clears up after minute two.

item.title: A brief introduction
item.description: Actual People, Actual Play is a podcast about how a roleplaying games’ rules affect our play groups creative process.  The show is not a recording of play sessions.  Instead, the term actual play is used here more the way you would see it on a message board.  Our formula is one part the story created during play, one part rules discussion, and one part discussion of our over all experience.   We use the term actual people, because we are just fans of the games discussed.  We aren’t the designers and we certainly are not experts.  It is our hope others will benefit from our exploration of games we like.  We also hope our own experience is enriched by feedback from our listeners.
